feed.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [RBX1][Network] - Network equipment migration
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT May 21, 19:00 - 23:00 UTC

Mar 6, 00:49 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our "Dedicated Servers" offer.

Start time : 21/05/2024 19:00 UTC
End time : 21/05/2024 23:00 UTC
Service impact : During maintenance, you may experience losses on the public network.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our network infrastructure, we will have to carry out interventions on multiple network equipment

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - APIv6 BringYourOwnImage routes operation
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 23, 08:30 - 08:45 UTC

Mar 6, 15:16 UTC
Update - New start time : 23/04/2024 08:30 UTC
New end time : 23/04/2024 08:45 UTC
Service impact : Some API calls definitely removed.

Mar 6, 10:57 UTC
Update - We will be undergoing scheduled maintenance during this time.

Feb 14, 00:54 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Dedicated Servers offer.

Start time : 19/03/2024 09:30 UTC
End time : 19/03/2024 09:45 UTC
Service impact : Some API calls definitely removed.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our servers, this maintenance will enables customers to deploy cloudready images directly on their dedicated server.

The following API calls will be definitely removed:

GET /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/bringYourOwnImage

POST /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/bringYourOwnImage

DELETE /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/bringYourOwnImage

Customers can still use the Bring Your Own Image (BYOI) feature from the API call POST /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/install/start. More details can be found in the documentation page.
This change was required in order to add the new Bring Your Own Linux (BYOLinux) feature.
Bring Your Own Image (BYOI) / Bring Your Own Linux (BYOLinux), a comparison sheet - OVHcloud.

entry.title: [Worldwide][Dedicated Servers] - IPXE scripts migration
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 16, 08:30 - 08:45 UTC

Mar 5, 23:28 UTC
Scheduled - Start time :16/04/2024 08:30 UTC
End time : 16/04/2024 08:45 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy about IPXE (open-source implementation of the Preboot eXecution Environment), the following API calls will be definitely removed: POST /me/ipxeScript PUT /me/ipxeScript/{name} Customers can still use that feature by using the "bootScript" key within the PUT /dedicated/server/{serviceName} API call: see documentation for more details.

entry.title: [LIM3][Dedicated Servers] - Rack LIM0313A02B
entry.content:
Mar 6, 23:44 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 06/03/2024 23:01 UTC
End time : 06/03/2024 23:42 UTC
Root cause : Electrical disjunction.
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Mar 6, 23:11 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 06/03/2024 23:01 UTC
Service impact : Servers are unreachable in the rack LIM0313A02B.
Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

entry.title: [BHS7][Dedicated Servers] B720A03/B720A02
entry.content:
Mar 6, 18:16 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 06/03/2024 13:58 UTC
End time : 06/03/2024 18:12 UTC
Service impact : The situation is back to normal, the service is running nominally.
Root cause : It was due to a malfunction on a power supply

Mar 6, 18:09 UTC
Update - Our teams are fully mobilized and we will keep you informed of developments and the resolution of the incident.

Mar 6, 15:24 UTC
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Mar 6, 14:39 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Mar 6, 14:37 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 06/03/2024 13:58 UTC
Service impact : Some servers in the racks B720A03/ B720A02 are no longer responding.
Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.
